Title: Interior and exterior of east end of Cliff Palace, Mesa Verde
Creator: McKee, Thomas Michael, 1854-1939.
Summary: View of Native American (Anasazi) ruins at Cliff Palace, Mesa Verde National Park, Colorado. Shows stone walls and round and square multi-story cliff dwellings. Stone bricks are scattered on the ground.
Description: 1 negative : glass ; 13 x 18 cm. (5 x 7 in.); 1 photographic print ; 29 x 36 cm. (11 1/2 x 14 in.)
Is Part Of: C Photo Album 103. Thomas M. McKee Album.
Type of Material: Glass negatives.; Photographic prints.; Imaged.; Image
Subject: Indians of North America--Antiquities & archaeological sites--Colorado--Mesa Verde National Park--1900-1910.; Pueblo Indians--Antiquities & archaeological sites--Colorado--Mesa Verde National Park--1900-1910.; Cliff Palace (Colo.)--1900-1910.; Mesa Verde National Park (Colo.)--1900-1910.; Archaeological sites--Colorado--Mesa Verde National Park--1900-1910.; Cliff dwellings--Colorado--Mesa Verde National Park--1900-1910.
